p: The clinical characteristics of influenza, known as influenza-like illness (ILI), are similar to those caused by other viruses causing acute respiratory infection (ARI), and only laboratory confirmation permits a specific disease diagnosis. Because influenza is very common and, during seasonal epidemics, affects 10%â€“20% of the unvaccinated population [ 1], it is not feasible to confirm all suspected cases. Due to the lack of specificity of influenza symptoms [ 6] and because it is necessary to assess the disease burden, quantitative indicators of ILI or ARI are commonly used.
